intro: Metastelma sepicola, commonly known as the rock orchid, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its compact growth habit and striking, often fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows on rocky substrates, showcasing its adaptability to harsh environments. Its leaves are usually narrow and grass-like, while its flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Metastelma sepicola is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
